topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5366f027636872521c700000#post_5366f027636872521c700000
The idea that the correct position is always in the middle between two extremes. 

Here is why I find your statement offensive, it devalues truth. You claim that people debating, frequently aggressively I will grant you, what they believe to be true is just kids arguing. That people should not voice their opinions even in defense of truth or attempt to fight to have the truth taught.

You are free not to care about the argument, but do not call me childish for having a dog in the fight.

Also I love that all an atheist has to do to be "arrogant" is have an opinion.

Religious people have to blow each other up to be called militant, I just have to speak my mind to be militant.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5366f027636872521c700000#post_5366f027636872521c700000
The golden mean fallacy essentially states that the only group that is right is those that play the middle regardless of evidence to the contrary or any arguments.

To use a analogy it's like if one person states the moon landing was fake and the other person says it was true then the person playing the golden mean fallacy would say that the initial moon landing was fake and that a actual moon landing was later on.

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5366f21a63687264505b0100#post_5366f21a63687264505b0100
[bq="twistedmetalero"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5366f1d36368726f19b90000#post_5366f1d36368726f19b90000

is it about hardcore poker?[/bq]
<insert blackjack and hookers joke here>

It's about a ex-vampire goes around trying to help other people dealing with paranormal incidents.  I like the artstyle cause you can tell it's definitely a very low budget show, but they make good use of their budget art wise and even though they don't have the budget for intense high action fight scenes they make use of their budget artistically.  He doesn't so much as "defeat the evil <insert>" so much as try to help them get used to it.  The first arc he helps a girl realize she wasn't cursed by god, but she actually wanted the curse.  Third arc his girlfriend helps a girl possessed by a demon(No it didn't have anything to do with the girl's sexuality; rather she found the monkey's paw and wished on it) realize that just cause she doesn't swing that way doesn't mean they can't be friends.

topics.body:
"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5367040a6368727e3a530000#post_5367040a6368727e3a530000
The problem with the golden mean fallacy in political debates is that there is no actual political centre.  What I mean by that is the republican party and democrat party as a whole are fictional entities that are hold only together by arbitrary belief that they are a physical entity.  In other words there is no actual such thing as the republican or democrat party as a physical entity; they're fictional entities based on ideas used as a adjective to describe a group of individuals.

There's a reason why it's called the "golden mean fallacy" in that it only seems logical on the surface, but when you actually look at it objectively it doesn't make sense.

Tl:dr; "There is no spoon"
!http://stream1.gifsoup.com/view7/3328233/there-is-no-spoon-o.gif!
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

Add into that the fact that many strongly held political beliefs on both sides of the divide are utterly irreconcilable, questions where the only answers are agree, disagree or apathy.

Gay rights are a good example of this. Unless you just absolutely do not give a shit you more or less have to pick a side.
